1//! # Minimal gif encoder
2use std::io;
3use std::io::prelude::*;
4use std::fmt;
5use std::error;
6use std::borrow::Cow;
7
8use weezl::{BitOrder, encode::Encoder as LzwEncoder};
9
10use crate::traits::{WriteBytesExt};
11use crate::common::{AnyExtension, Block, DisposalMethod, Extension, Frame};
12
13#[derive(Debug)]
14enum FormatErrorKind {
15    /// The image has too many colors.
16    TooManyColors,
17    /// The image has no color palette which is required.
18    MissingColorPalette,
19}
20
21/// The image has incorrect properties, making it impossible to encode as a gif.
22#[derive(Debug)]
23pub struct EncodingFormatError {
24    kind: FormatErrorKind
25}
26
27impl error::Error for EncodingFormatError {}
28impl fmt::Display for EncodingFormatError {
29    fn fmt(&self, fmt: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> fmt::Result {
30        match self.kind {
31            FormatErrorKind::TooManyColors => write!(fmt, "the image has too many colors"),
32            FormatErrorKind::MissingColorPalette => write!(fmt, "the GIF format requires a color palette but none was given")
33        }
34    }
35}
36
37impl From<FormatErrorKind> for EncodingFormatError {
38    fn from(kind: FormatErrorKind) -> Self {
39        EncodingFormatError { kind }
40    }
41}
42
43#[derive(Debug)]
44/// Encoding error.
45pub enum EncodingError {
46    /// Returned if the to image is not encodable as a gif.
47    Format(EncodingFormatError),
48    /// Wraps `std::io::Error`.
49    Io(io::Error),
50}
51
52impl fmt::Display for EncodingError {
53    fn fmt(&self, fmt: &mut fmt::Formatter) -> fmt::Result {
54        match self {
55            EncodingError::Io(err) => err.fmt(fmt),
56            EncodingError::Format(err) => err.fmt(fmt),
57        }
58    }
59}
60
61impl error::Error for EncodingError {
62    fn source(&self) -> Option<&(dyn error::Error + 'static)> {
63        match self {
64            EncodingError::Io(err) => Some(err),
65            EncodingError::Format(err) => Some(err),
66        }
67    }
68}
69
70impl From<io::Error> for EncodingError {
71    fn from(err: io::Error) -> Self {
72        EncodingError::Io(err)
73    }
74}
75
76impl From<EncodingFormatError> for EncodingError {
77    fn from(err: EncodingFormatError) -> Self {
78        EncodingError::Format(err)
79    }
80}
81
82impl From<FormatErrorKind> for EncodingError {
83    fn from(kind: FormatErrorKind) -> Self {
84        EncodingError::Format(kind.into())
85    }
86}
87
88
89/// Number of repetitions
90#[derive(Copy, Clone, Debug)]
91pub enum Repeat {
92    /// Finite number of repetitions
93    Finite(u16),
94    /// Infinite number of repetitions
95    Infinite
96}
97
98/// Extension data.
99pub enum ExtensionData {
100    /// Control extension. Use `ExtensionData::new_control_ext` to construct.
101    Control {
102        /// Flags.
103        flags: u8,
104        /// Frame delay.
105        delay: u16,
106        /// Transparent index.
107        trns: u8
108    },
109    /// Sets the number of repetitions
110    Repetitions(Repeat)
111}
112
113impl ExtensionData {
114    /// Constructor for control extension data.
115    ///
116    /// `delay` is given in units of 10 ms.
117    pub fn new_control_ext(delay: u16, dispose: DisposalMethod,
118                           needs_user_input: bool, trns: Option<u8>) -> ExtensionData {
119        let mut flags = 0;
120        let trns = match trns {
121            Some(trns) => {
122                flags |= 1;
123                trns as u8
124            },
125            None => 0
126        };
127        flags |= (needs_user_input as u8) << 1;
128        flags |= (dispose as u8) << 2;
129        ExtensionData::Control {
130            flags: flags,
131            delay: delay,
132            trns: trns
133        }
134    }
135}
136
137impl<W: Write> Encoder<W> {
138    /// Creates a new encoder.
139    ///
140    /// `global_palette` gives the global color palette in the format `[r, g, b, ...]`,
141    /// if no global palette shall be used an empty slice may be supplied.
142    pub fn new(w: W, width: u16, height: u16, global_palette: &[u8]) -> Result<Self, EncodingError> {
143        let buffer_size = (width as usize) * (height as usize);
144        Encoder {
145            w: Some(w),
146            global_palette: false,
147            width: width,
148            height: height,
149            buffer: Vec::with_capacity(buffer_size)
150        }.write_global_palette(global_palette)
151    }
152
153    /// Write an extension block that signals a repeat behaviour.
154    pub fn set_repeat(&mut self, repeat: Repeat) -> Result<(), EncodingError> {
155        self.write_extension(ExtensionData::Repetitions(repeat))
156    }
157
158    /// Writes the global color palette.
159    pub fn write_global_palette(mut self, palette: &[u8]) -> Result<Self, EncodingError> {
160        self.global_palette = true;
161        let mut flags = 0;
162        flags |= 0b1000_0000;
163        let num_colors = palette.len() / 3;
164        if num_colors > 256 {
165            return Err(EncodingError::from(FormatErrorKind::TooManyColors));
166        }
167        // Size of global color table.
168        flags |= flag_size(num_colors);
169        // Color resolution .. FIXME. This is mostly ignored (by ImageMagick at least) but hey, we
170        // should use some sensible value here or even allow configuring it?
171        flags |= flag_size(num_colors) << 4; // wtf flag
172        self.write_screen_desc(flags)?;
173        self.write_color_table(palette)?;
174        Ok(self)
175    }
176
177    /// Writes a frame to the image.
178    ///
179    /// Note: This function also writes a control extension if necessary.
180    pub fn write_frame(&mut self, frame: &Frame) -> Result<(), EncodingError> {
181        self.write_frame_header(frame)?;
182        self.write_image_block(&frame.buffer)
183    }
184
185    fn write_frame_header(&mut self, frame: &Frame) -> Result<(), EncodingError> {
186        // TODO commented off to pass test in lib.rs
187        //if frame.delay > 0 || frame.transparent.is_some() {
188            self.write_extension(ExtensionData::new_control_ext(
189                frame.delay,
190                frame.dispose,
191                frame.needs_user_input,
192                frame.transparent
193
194            ))?;
195        //}
196        let writer = self.w.as_mut().unwrap();
197        writer.write_le(Block::Image as u8)?;
198        writer.write_le(frame.left)?;
199        writer.write_le(frame.top)?;
200        writer.write_le(frame.width)?;
201        writer.write_le(frame.height)?;
202        let mut flags = 0;
203        if frame.interlaced {
204            flags |= 0b0100_0000;
205        }
206        match frame.palette {
207            Some(ref palette) => {
208                flags |= 0b1000_0000;
209                let num_colors = palette.len() / 3;
210                if num_colors > 256 {
211                    return Err(EncodingError::from(FormatErrorKind::TooManyColors));
212                }
213                flags |= flag_size(num_colors);
214                writer.write_le(flags)?;
215                self.write_color_table(palette)
216            },
217            None => if !self.global_palette {
218                Err(EncodingError::from(FormatErrorKind::MissingColorPalette))
219            } else {
220                writer.write_le(flags).map_err(Into::into)
221            }
222        }
223    }
224
225    fn write_image_block(&mut self, data: &[u8]) -> Result<(), EncodingError> {
226        self.buffer.clear();
227        lzw_encode(data, &mut self.buffer);
228
229        let writer = self.w.as_mut().unwrap();
230        Self::write_encoded_image_block(writer, &self.buffer)
231    }
232
233    fn write_encoded_image_block(writer: &mut W, data_with_min_code_size: &[u8]) -> Result<(), EncodingError> {
234        let (&min_code_size, data) = data_with_min_code_size.split_first().unwrap_or((&2, &[]));
235        writer.write_le(min_code_size)?;
236
237        // Write blocks. `chunks_exact` seems to be slightly faster
238        // than `chunks` according to both Rust docs and benchmark results.
239        let mut iter = data.chunks_exact(0xFF);
240        while let Some(full_block) = iter.next() {
241            writer.write_le(0xFFu8)?;
242            writer.write_all(full_block)?;
243        }
244        let last_block = iter.remainder();
245        if !last_block.is_empty() {
246            writer.write_le(last_block.len() as u8)?;
247            writer.write_all(last_block)?;
248        }
249        writer.write_le(0u8).map_err(Into::into)
250    }
251
252    fn write_color_table(&mut self, table: &[u8]) -> Result<(), EncodingError> {
253        let writer = self.w.as_mut().unwrap();
254        let num_colors = table.len() / 3;
255        if num_colors > 256 {
256            return Err(EncodingError::from(FormatErrorKind::TooManyColors));
257        }
258        let size = flag_size(num_colors);
259        writer.write_all(&table[..num_colors * 3])?;
260        // Waste some space as of gif spec
261        for _ in 0..((2 << size) - num_colors) {
262            writer.write_all(&[0, 0, 0])?
263        }
264        Ok(())
265    }
266
267    /// Writes an extension to the image.
268    ///
269    /// It is normally not necessary to call this method manually.
270    pub fn write_extension(&mut self, extension: ExtensionData) -> Result<(), EncodingError> {
271        use self::ExtensionData::*;
272        // 0 finite repetitions can only be achieved
273        // if the corresponting extension is not written
274        if let Repetitions(Repeat::Finite(0)) = extension {
275            return Ok(())
276        }
277        let writer = self.w.as_mut().unwrap();
278        writer.write_le(Block::Extension as u8)?;
279        match extension {
280            Control { flags, delay, trns } => {
281                writer.write_le(Extension::Control as u8)?;
282                writer.write_le(4u8)?;
283                writer.write_le(flags)?;
284                writer.write_le(delay)?;
285                writer.write_le(trns)?;
286            }
287            Repetitions(repeat) => {
288                writer.write_le(Extension::Application as u8)?;
289                writer.write_le(11u8)?;
290                writer.write_all(b"NETSCAPE2.0")?;
291                writer.write_le(3u8)?;
292                writer.write_le(1u8)?;
293                match repeat {
294                    Repeat::Finite(no) => writer.write_le(no)?,
295                    Repeat::Infinite => writer.write_le(0u16)?,
296                }
297            }
298        }
299        writer.write_le(0u8).map_err(Into::into)
300    }
301
302    /// Writes a raw extension to the image.
303    ///
304    /// This method can be used to write an unsupported extension to the file. `func` is the extension
305    /// identifier (e.g. `Extension::Application as u8`). `data` are the extension payload blocks. If any
306    /// contained slice has a lenght > 255 it is automatically divided into sub-blocks.
307    pub fn write_raw_extension(&mut self, func: AnyExtension, data: &[&[u8]]) -> io::Result<()> {
308        let writer = self.w.as_mut().unwrap();
309        writer.write_le(Block::Extension as u8)?;
310        writer.write_le(func.0)?;
311        for block in data {
312            for chunk in block.chunks(0xFF) {
313                writer.write_le(chunk.len() as u8)?;
314                writer.write_all(chunk)?;
315            }
316        }
317        writer.write_le(0u8)
318    }
319
320    /// Writes a frame to the image, but expects `Frame.buffer` to contain LZW-encoded data
321    /// from [`Frame::make_lzw_pre_encoded`].
322    ///
323    /// Note: This function also writes a control extension if necessary.
324    pub fn write_lzw_pre_encoded_frame(&mut self, frame: &Frame) -> Result<(), EncodingError> {
325        self.write_frame_header(frame)?;
326        let writer = self.w.as_mut().unwrap();
327        Self::write_encoded_image_block(writer, &frame.buffer)
328    }
329
330    /// Writes the logical screen desriptor
331    fn write_screen_desc(&mut self, flags: u8) -> io::Result<()> {
332        let writer = self.w.as_mut().unwrap();
333        writer.write_all(b"GIF89a")?;
334        writer.write_le(self.width)?;
335        writer.write_le(self.height)?;
336        writer.write_le(flags)?; // packed field
337        writer.write_le(0u8)?; // bg index
338        writer.write_le(0u8) // aspect ratio
339    }
340
341    /// Gets a reference to the writer instance used by this encoder.
342    pub fn get_ref(&self) -> &W {
343        self.w.as_ref().unwrap()
344    }
345
346    /// Gets a mutable reference to the writer instance used by this encoder.
347    ///
348    /// It is inadvisable to directly write to the underlying writer.
349    pub fn get_mut(&mut self) -> &mut W {
350        self.w.as_mut().unwrap()
351    }
352
353    /// Returns writer instance used by this encoder
354    pub fn into_inner(mut self) -> io::Result<W> {
355        self.write_trailer()?;
356        Ok(self.w.take().unwrap())
357    }
358
359    /// Write the final tailer.
360    fn write_trailer(&mut self) -> io::Result<()> {
361        self.w.as_mut().unwrap().write_le(Block::Trailer as u8)
362    }
363}
364
365/// Encodes the data into the provided buffer.
366///
367/// The first byte is the minimum code size, followed by LZW data.
368fn lzw_encode(data: &[u8], buffer: &mut Vec<u8>) {
369    let min_code_size = match flag_size(1 + data.iter().copied().max().unwrap_or(0) as usize) + 1 {
370        1 => 2, // As per gif spec: The minimal code size has to be >= 2
371        n => n
372    };
373    buffer.push(min_code_size);
374    let mut enc = LzwEncoder::new(BitOrder::Lsb, min_code_size);
375    let len = enc.into_vec(buffer).encode_all(data).consumed_out;
376    buffer.truncate(len+1);
377}
378
379impl Frame<'_> {
380    /// Replace frame's buffer with a LZW-compressed one for use with [`Encoder::write_lzw_pre_encoded_frame`].
381    ///
382    /// Frames can be compressed in any order, separately from the `Encoder`, which can be used to compress frames in parallel.
383    pub fn make_lzw_pre_encoded(&mut self) {
384        let mut buffer = Vec::with_capacity(self.buffer.len() / 2);
385        lzw_encode(&self.buffer, &mut buffer);
386        self.buffer = Cow::Owned(buffer);
387    }
388}
389
390/// GIF encoder.
391pub struct Encoder<W: Write> {
392    w: Option<W>,
393    global_palette: bool,
394    width: u16,
395    height: u16,
396    buffer: Vec<u8>
397}
398
399impl<W: Write> Drop for Encoder<W> {
400
401    #[cfg(feature = "raii_no_panic")]
402    fn drop(&mut self) {
403        if self.w.is_some() {
404            let _ = self.write_trailer();
405        }
406    }
407
408    #[cfg(not(feature = "raii_no_panic"))]
409    fn drop(&mut self) {
410        if self.w.is_some() {
411            self.write_trailer().unwrap();
412        }
413    }
414}
415
416// Color table size converted to flag bits
417fn flag_size(size: usize) -> u8 {
418    match size {
419        0  ..=2   => 0,
420        3  ..=4   => 1,
421        5  ..=8   => 2,
422        9  ..=16  => 3,
423        17 ..=32  => 4,
424        33 ..=64  => 5,
425        65 ..=128 => 6,
426        129..=256 => 7,
427        _ => 7
428    }
429}
430
431#[test]
432fn error_cast() {
433    let _ : Box<dyn error::Error> = EncodingError::from(FormatErrorKind::MissingColorPalette).into();
434}
